reviewText:
Early Access Review

Disclaimer: Was given a free copy by the developer.

Ok, so tl:dr, I recommend it, because its cool and your biceps will get an awesome workout.

Positives
You get to throw fireballs, IN SPACE!
It's kind of like breakout or arkanoid, except in VR with giant fireballs from both hands.
Beating all 60 levels will work your arms like you won't believe and It's pretty fun.

Cons
Not a whole lot of meat" to the game yet
recommended: so hopefully that's coming.\nThe game mechanic in it's current form is kind of simplistic
voteText: early access so hopefully thats also on the way.\n\nIn either case
helpfulPercent: $5 is cheaper than lunch and this game will help you burn that off

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIf you ever wanted to feel what it's like to be inside a classic arcade game, this VR experience is for you.  It's an atmospheric, mesmerizing take on the classic block breaker.   I had a lot of fun just looking around and enjoying the environment and vibing to the music.   The game play involves throwing balls at a series of block puzzles.  It's simple at first, but grows more challenging as you must find a strategy to work the angles and throw around obstacles.  You'll do a lot of damage throwing balls and work hard enough to get an arm workout.  Along the way you'll discover a few zen moments of destruction toppling down massive block walls, and satisfaction when balls lobbed around a corner connect with the intended target.   It's a lot of fun to be able to throw and break things in VR, and just like a classic arcade game you can expect a frenzied escape from the ordinary.
Early Access Review\n\nLike throwing baseballs at milk bottles in space. Can't wait to see more updates and levels. 10/10
